etymology.description: 高丽(古名“高丽”/Koryŏ) + 菜(vegetable) = “Korean vegetable” → cabbage.
etymology.interpretation: Uses the old Chinese name for Korea to label a vegetable associated with or introduced via Korea. In Taiwan and Southern Sinitic speech, it became the common term for headed cabbage.
etymology.simplification: 麗 → 丽 by character simplification; the term itself is regional, with Mainland more often saying 卷心菜/包心菜/甘蓝.

examples.chinese: 在台湾，炒高丽菜很受欢迎(在臺灣，炒高麗菜很受歡迎)。
examples.pinyin: Zài Táiwān, chǎo gāolícài hěn shòu huānyíng.
examples.english: In Taiwan, stir-fried cabbage is very popular.

examples.chinese: 我买了一颗高丽菜准备做沙拉(我買了一顆高麗菜準備做沙拉)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎile yì kē gāolícài zhǔnbèi zuò shālā.
examples.english: I bought a head of cabbage to make a salad.

examples.chinese: 高丽菜也叫卷心菜，在大陆更常用这个说法(高麗菜也叫捲心菜，在大陸更常用這個說法)。
examples.pinyin: Gāolícài yě jiào juǎnxīncài, zài Dàlù gèng cháng yòng zhège shuōfǎ.
examples.english: It’s also called juǎnxīncài; on the Mainland this term is more common.
